Human history is a history of expeditions – geographic and political, scientific and cultural, spiritual and philosophical. The term refers to journeys undertaken into fully or partially unknown territory for a very specific purpose. Learning Expeditions are the 21st-century version of these voyages known to expand the horizons of their time. Learning Expeditions take current and future leaders into unfamiliar environments and uncover insights that will once again change the game.My role at WDHB has led me into San Francisco many times, Boston, New York & London Innovation Hubs.   This year I am excited to Facilitate additional Learning Expeditions in Shanghai, Copenhagen, San Francisco, Tel Aviv & Singapore.     I have facilitated and visited with Innovative companies such as Google, Facebook, Apple, Cisco, Adobe, Intel, Autodesk, Dropbox, Salesforce, Indiegogo, Filld, Ridecell, Drive.AI, Delphi, Butchershop, Modcloth, Eurostar, What 3 Words, Carbon 3D, GE Digital, Rocketspace, Lego, Barclays, BP, British Gas, Virgin, Adidas, BNY Melon, The Lending Club, Paypal, Crowd Companies, Pfizer, MetLife, AMEX, AIG, The Met, JP Morgan, Rehab Studios, JnJ, L'Oreal, Vice Media, TIAA-CREF, Gilt, Intuit, Plug & Play, 500 Startups, FujiFilm, Coca-Cola, Starbucks,  Telenav, Phillips, Huawei, BitAuto, Chinaccelerator, DHL, Amazon, Hubspot, Linkedin, YouTube, Alibaba, YouKo, IDEO, Stanford D.School, Singularity University, Daimler, Belfius, WeWork, Baidu, M&C Saatchi, Publicis, Oracle, NASA, Thinkubator, IBM, Danske Bank, State of Green, Ramboll, Space 10, Danfoss, Novo Nordisk, Copenhagen Solutions Lab, Maersk, Donkey Republic, Copenhagen Institute of Future Studies, Green Mobility, Trust Pilot, Budweiser, Coors and McDonalds.

ASU is a comprehensive public research university, measured not by whom it excludes, but by whom it includes and how they succeed; advancing research and discovery of public value; and assuming fundamental responsibility for the economic, social, cultural and overall health of the communities it serves. Arizona State University (ASU) has become the foundational model for the New American University, a new paradigm for the public research university that transforms higher education. ASU is committed to excellence, access and impact in everything that it does.“#1 university for innovation.” (#2 Stanford, #3 MIT)—US News & World Report, 2015, 2016 & 2017Roles:Developing Course: Entrepreneurship in Biomedicine (2017)Completed: ASU Masters Class for Teaching Online (2017)Faculty Associate in Entrepreneurship & Innovation,  ASU International School of Biomedical Informatics (2017-Present) Entrepreneur-in-Residence, Arizona Commerce Authority (2015-Present) Chief Facilitator, Center for Entrepreneurship & Innovation, SkySong (2015-2017)* Startup School - designed & developed  NEW curriculum with goal of reaching 1,000,000 students. * Entrepreneurship Outreach Network - facilitated to Mesa, Goodyear, Phoenix, Buckeye, Tempe and Apache Junction. * SVA/DSI, School of Visual Arts, Design in Social Innovation, Faculty at Large (2016)* Stanford D.School, University Innovation Fellows, Teaching & Learning Studio (2016)* Verizon Innovative Learning - keynote for Innovative Learning & developed Business Model lesson.  * Prepped* SparXX* Cisco Poder Program Entrepreneur-in-Residence, WP Carey School of Business  (2015)Guest Lecturer, WP Carey School of Business  (2014)Entrepreneur-in-Residence, Fulton School of Engineering (2015)Entrepreneur-in-Residence, Thunderbird Global School of Management (2008-2014)Entrepreneurship + Innovation Instructor, Thunderbird Global School of Management (2009-2014)Mentor, ASU Technopolis (2006-2009)

Kaospilot is an education in Creative Project, Process, Business and Leadership Design. As well as a school, the Kaospilot is a change agency. We work as a partner with our clients – using individual, organizational and business development to help them thrive on their dreams and challenges – and deliver value that lasts.Kaospilot has been dubbed "the world's most adventurous alternative business school"​ by Fast Company and marked by Business Week as a design program "shaping a new generation of creative managers"​, it's a fun and above all innovative place.

At Purposely, we are passionate about creating pathways for students to help them land their career of choice.   Our goal is to give students the training they need to translate their academic journey into a life and job of purpose.  Sold to new management team in 2014.

summary: Aaron D. Bare is a Design-minded Entrepreneur, Thunderbird B.School / Stanford D.School / Singularity grad with experience as an I-Banker, Consultant & Advertising Executive, who has sold 12 companies, & built numerous others as a co-founder, strategist or advisor. Aaron is currently working with WDHB, KAOSPILOT & Hyper Island facilitating companies on Innovation, he is a Lecturer at Arizona State University (ASU) & CTO at Primer Strategy.  Aaron was previously EIR at Thunderbird & ASU, CEO of Buzz Mouth, Management Consultant at Accenture & Money Manager at Vanguard.  Aaron learned to code in 1995 & in grad school at IU was part of UITS.  Aaron continued coding at Accenture & built first website for Culligan & a CRM for Walgreens.  Aaron also created over 400 websites & 20 mobile apps at BuzzMouth.  Then, Aaron created 100's of hours of video content while at JobingTV, CareerTours & Purposely.    Aaron is a member of the Society of Fellows at the Aspen Institute, previously with the McCain Institute & Google Ideas on Illicit Networks & Anti-Extremism.   Aaron's work was featured in Wired Magazine's Danger Room.  He received his MBA in Global Management from Thunderbird School of Global Management, MA in Economic Development from Indiana University, BS with Honors in International Business from Indiana Institute of Technology.Aaron speaks often about disruption through a series of speeches sponsored by the Kauffman Foundation, Global Sales Summit, Tijuana Innovadora & RUSTIC. Aaron’s success & proven performance as a leader in his field garnered him acknowledgement as “35 under 35” Entrepreneurs; “40 under 40” Leaders; also selected as Most Innovative Company of the Year & featured in the likes of the Wall Street Journal, Wired, Fast Company, and Inc. Magazine. Aaron lives with his family in Scottsdale, he enjoys traveling, sailing & skiing.
name: Aaron D. Bare
title: Innovation Facilitator.  Growth Strategist.  Technologist.
